metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9185 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
In OpenStack Heat, by launching a new Heat stack with a local URL an authenticated user may conduct network discovery revealing internal network configuration. Affected versions are <=5.0.3, >=6.0.0 <=6.1.0, and ==7.0.0.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9185` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

heat-api - 1:6.1.2-0ubuntu1
heat-api-cfn - 1:6.1.2-0ubuntu1
heat-api-cloudwatch - 1:6.1.2-0ubuntu1
heat-common - 1:6.1.2-0ubuntu1
heat-engine - 1:6.1.2-0ubuntu1
python-heat - 1:6.1.2-0ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: heat package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:6.1.2-0ubuntu1').
